author: wsjcom
title: Equal Justice? McCabe Should Be Worried
text: Regarding your editorial “Andrew McCabe and Consequences” (March 16): I retired from the FBI after 28-plus years of service. All agents, as far back as their initial training at the FBI Academy, know the punishment for lack of candor in administrative inquiries and internal-affairs investigations by the Office of Inspector General or Office of Professional Responsibility is dismissal. It is not admonishment, censure or suspension but dismissal. Every quarter the FBI’s Inspection Division promulgates a report of misconduct emailed to all employees that highlights adjudicated cases and includes the penalties assessed. Typically...
